definition: disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration

sentences.english: The UN force was strung out across northern Korea and not prepared for a Chinese attack.
sentences.chinese: 联合国部队在朝鲜摆开阵势，并未防备中国的进攻。

sentences.english: See a white sergeant that battle, and quickly put the black sergeant pulled aside for extra.
sentences.chinese: 白警长一见这阵势，赶紧把黑警长拽到一边。

sentences.english: Already, Republicans are lining up in opposition to a government-directed jobs initiative.
sentences.chinese: 共和党已经排好阵势，反对由政府主导的就业计划。

sentences.english: The whole company were drawn up, prepared for battle.
sentences.chinese: 全连已列好阵势，准备战斗。

sentences.english: His soldiers were arrayed along the river bank .
sentences.chinese: 他的士兵沿著河岸摆开阵势。

sentences.english: Most agree they have never quite seen anything like it.
sentences.chinese: 大多数选民都同意，他们从来没有见过这样的阵势。

sentences.english: The troops fanned out in a northerly direction.
sentences.chinese: 队伍到达开阔地便成扇形摆开阵势。

sentences.english: The political parties have lined up behind their candidates.
sentences.chinese: 各政党都已摆开了阵势来支持自己的候选人。

sentences.english: The dogs began to yip and howl, but tonight they kept their places.
sentences.chinese: 狗也摆好阵势，要狂吠了，但是今晚，他们按兵不动。

sentences.english: His soldiers were arrayed along the river bank.
sentences.chinese: 他的士兵沿着河岸摆开阵势。

sentences.english: The troops fanned out as they reached open ground.
sentences.chinese: 队伍到达开阔地便成扇形摆开阵势。

sentences.english: And thy choice valleys shall be full of chariots, and the horseman shall place themselves in the gate.
sentences.chinese: 你最富丽的山谷充满了战车，骑兵已在门前布好阵势。

definition: formation (of a sports team, troops etc)
(computing) array (data structure)/(hardware) array (photovoltaic cells, radio telescopes etc)
combined assault/to mount a joint attack
